intro: Stenactis alabamensis, commonly known as the Alabama stenactis, is a rare flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
